#Text=Metro Cebu
#Text=Metro Cebu is in Cebu Province in the Philippines .

#Text=It is the country 's second largest urban area , after Metro Manila , and the main urban center both of the province and of the larger Visayas region which forms the central third of the country .
#Text=Metro Cebu has more than 60 % of the total population of the province . .
#Text=Metro Cebu is the main transport hub for southern parts of the country , either the Visayas or Mindanao .
#Text=Both Mactan-Cebu International Airport and the port in Cebu City are quite busy .
#Text=Cities
#Text=Three main cities make up the core of Metro Cebu ; each has its own goverment and its own Wikvoyage article :
#Text=— on Cebu Island ; has the port , provincial government , many hotels , extensive shopping , lively nightlife , and much else .
#Text=( population in 2015 census 923,000 )
#Text=— a residential and industrial town located on Cebu Island between Cebu City and Lapu-Lapu .
#Text=— on Mactan Island east of Cebu City ; has the airport , some nice beaches and dive sites , and many high-end resorts .
#Text=For practical purposes , the three are in effect a single city ; taxis , jeepneys and buses are available so travel between them is easy .
#Text=There are two large bridges between Mandaue and Lapu-Lapu , and many roads between Manadue and Cebu city .
#Text=A third bridge , running direct from Cebu City to Córdova ( the southern part of Mactan ) , is under construction , planned to be in service by 2021 .
#Text=Unlike the two existing bridges the new one will be several km long and will have a toll .
#Text=Cebu City has most of the region 's historical sights and a range of facilities for travellers : accommodation , food and entertainment .
#Text=It is therefore the main tourist destination in the region .
#Text=However many travellers will also visit other areas : Lapu-Lapu for the airport , and anywhere except Cebu City for beach resorts .
#Text=The administrative region of Metro Cebu is shown in red on the map below , with the rest of Cebu Province in white .
#Text=The region extends well beyond the three core cities and includes various suburbs or towns for which Wikivoyage has separate articles .
#Text=In each list below , the towns are ordered from Cebu City outwards :
#Text=East of Cebu City , on other islands :
#Text=Lapu-Lapu , connected to Mandaue by bridges
#Text=— on Mactan Island , south of Lapu-Lapu
#Text=— Easternmost part of the metro area , a short ferry ride from Lapu-Lapu , but fairly rural .
#Text=Has mangrove swamps , a wildlife sanctuary popular with bird watchers , a large reef area with good diving , and some mid-range resorts .
#Text=South of Cebu City , on Cebu Island :
#Text=— a residential and trading center directly bordering Cebu City .
#Text=Talisay has the fourth largest population of any municipality in the region .
#Text=Arguably it ( or a Talisay/Minglanilla combination ) should be considered a fourth core city .
#Text=— largely a bedroom suburb just south of Talisay , known for its Sugat festival
#Text=— has the largest factory in the country , making cement , and also a number of seaside resorts
#Text=— more of a country area than a city region , though there is a town ; has resorts both in a mountain area and along the coast
#Text=— Old colonial town on the coast with a few interesting historic buildings .
#Text=North of Cebu City , on Cebu Island :
#Text=Mandaue , directly bordering Cebu City and with bridges to Lapu-Lapu
#Text=— mainly residential suburb north of Mandaue
#Text=— coastal suburb , home of the Rosquillos , a type of cookie .
#Text=— municipality with a few coastal resorts and attractions inland in the hills
#Text=— 40 km from the city .
#Text=Has ferries to the Camotes Islands
#Text=All municipalities have some sea coast and all except Cebu City itself have some beach resorts .
#Text=Many of the townships also extend up into the island 's somewhat mountainous interior , but most of the population is along the coast .
#Text=Understand
#Text=This is an overview article .
#Text=The tourist attractions , hotels , eateries and bars are described in the articles for cities within the urban conglomerate , mainly Cebu City and Lapu-Lapu .
#Text=The region has many resident foreigners , both employed and retired .
#Text=Under Philippine law foreigners cannot own land but they can buy condominiums , and there are condo developments in many parts of the country catering to that market and to well-off Filipinos .
#Text=In this area most foreigners are in Cebu City , in Lapu-Lapu which has many high-end condos near beaches , or in the bedroom suburbs Mandaue , Talisay and Minglanilla .
#Text=Climate
#Text=The region has a tropical monsoon climate with a long wet season and a short dry season , only the months of March and April .
#Text=Average temperatures show little variance during the year ; average daily highs range from to in various months and lows from to .
#Text=Cebu City averages roughly of precipitation annually .
#Text=As anywhere in the country , there is some risk of typhoon s.
#Text=Cebu is south of the most dangerous areas but does get hit by some storms .
#Text=Nearby areas with somewhat less rain and lower typhoon risk are Bohol or Dumaguete further south .
#Text=Get in

#Text=It is possible to arrive at the airport , go directly to one of Lapu-Lapu 's resorts , not visit Cebu City ( or only go there on a guided tour ) , and be almost entirely insulated from the Philippines .
#Text=Some package holidays , mainly for Japanese and Koreans , do exactly this .
#Text=By plane

#Text=For air travel , Mactan-Cebu International Airport ( CEB ) is in Lapu-Lapu ; it has many international flights plus domestic flights to and from most major cities in the southern Philippines , direct flights to some cities in the north and connections via Manila to most of the others .
#Text=Many travellers land at the airport then take the My Bus or a taxi into Cebu City .
#Text=By boat
#Text=For travel by sea , the port in Cebu City is the busiest in the country ; it is the main hub for the Visayas region and has connections to many cities outside that region .
#Text=Mandaue has quite a large container port , and more-or-less every town in the region has a port area or at least a few docks .
#Text=Most of these are of zero interest to visitors ; the exception is a dock in Lapu-Lapu which has boats to Olango Island and Bohol .
